definitions.definition: a document that you send to somebody using email
the act of joining one thing to another; a thing that joins two things together
definitions.sensetop: attachment of something to somethingattachment to something

examples.text: All cars have points for the attachment of safety restraints.
They discussed the attachment of new conditions to the peace plans.
They had to check the strength of the seat attachments to the floor of the plane.

definitions.definition: a feeling of love for somebody/something

examples.text: a child’s strong attachment to its parents
Prisoners can develop attachments to their guards.

definitions.definition: belief in and support for an idea or a set of values

examples.text: the popular attachment to democratic government

definitions.definition: a tool that you can fix onto a machine, to make it do another job

examples.text: an electric drill with a range of different attachments

definitions.definition: a short time spent working with an organization such as a hospital, school or part of the armed forces

examples.text: She's on attachment to the local hospital.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘arrest for contempt of court’): from Old French attachement, from atachier ‘fasten, fix’ or estachier, based on an element of Germanic origin related to stake ‘post’.
